name: Understanding Roadway Safety in American Indian Reservations: Perceptions and Management of Risk by Community, Tribal Governments, and Other Safety Leaders
purpose: This study examines roadway safety in American Indian reservations, highlighting critical concerns such as pedestrian safety, road maintenance, reckless driving, and the need for better inter-agency coordination. Using extensive qualitative data from four tribal case studies and a national survey, it identifies key priorities and offers policy-relevant recommendations to reduce high rates of motor vehicle fatalities and injuries among American Indians
author: Kathryn Quick, Guillermo Narvaez
image_description: Map of MN with Anishinaabe Reservations and Dakota Communities labeled separately.
